The advisory now takes on this profile to tweet the president's speech in the delivery of the final report of the #NationalDaVerdadeCommission
RT @TVNBR: LIVE: Dilma Rousseff speaks during the presentation of the final report @CNV_Brazil. Follow on @TVNBR http://t.co/JxJyBzXSWW
The report qa #NationalDaVerdadeCommission makes public today is the result of 2 years and 7 months of intense work.
I get this report and I'm sure it closes one step and at the same time marks a new beginning. #CNV Report
I am sure that this #CNV Report results from the Commission's effort to achieve its 3 + important objectives:
the search for factual truth, respect for memory and the encouragement of the country's reconciliation with itself, through information and knowledge
We love democracy, we hope that the release of this report will reaffirm the priority we must give to democratic freedoms ...
... as well as the absolute aversion q we must always manifest to authoritarianism and to dictatorships of any kind.
We hope this report contributes to the fact that ghosts from a painful past can not protect themselves in the shadows of silence and omission.
At the installation of #CNV in 2012, he said that ignorance about non-pacific history, on the contrary, holds latent sorrows and grudges.
He said that misinformation does not help to appease, it only facilitates the transit of intolerance. #CNV Report
I also affirmed that Brazil and the new generations deserved the truth, and, above all, those who lost friends deserved the truth (...)
(...) and relatives and q continue to suffer as if they die again and again every day. #CNV Report
The work of #CNV reinforces the feelings I expressed: who gives voice to history are free men and women who are not afraid to write it.
On behalf of the Brazilian State and on my behalf, I pay homage and express a warm thanks to the members of #CNV.
I acknowledge and thank, above all, those who, with courage and enormous generosity, have accepted to testify and tell their stories (...)
(...) and the stories of friends and companions who lived through times of pain, suffering and great losses. #CNV Report
The search for historical truth is a way to build democracy and watch over its preservation. #CNV Report
Knowing history is an indispensable condition to be able to build it better. #CNV Report
From now on, all Brazilians, and I insist on highlighting young people who were born in the last 30 years, will have easy access, via the internet ...
(...) to the report of this Committee and relevant information about our history and the formation of the Brazilian society.
Truth does not mean seeking revenge. Truth does not have to be grounds for hatred or reckoning.
Truth produces awareness, learning, knowledge, and respect. #CNV Report
Truth means, above all, the opportunity to appease each individual with himself and a people with his history. #CNV Report
The truth is a tribute to a Brazil that already traces 3 decades of a democratic way. And we will fight always and more p / q so it persists.
Hj, the world celebrates the International Day of Human Rights, in honor of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which turns 66 years.
Making this report public on this date is a tribute to all women and men in the world who have fought for freedom and democracy (...)
(...) and with this struggle helped to build civilizational frameworks and made humanity better.
Congratulations to the # NationalDavidNationalCommittee and to all who contributed to the production of this report.
Society will know how to recognize the importance of this work, which makes our democracy even stronger.

The advisory now takes this profile to tweet the president's speech in the delivery of the #Human Rights Prize
RT @blogplanalto: #AOVIVO - President Dilma speaks at the ceremony of delivery of the 20th Prize #DireitosHumanos 2014: http://t.co/cORCqino8b
The #Human Rights Award is the highest government award in this area and in this activity.
I am very proud to be here, as the people here contribute to the fight against human rights violations.
Each of the twenty-three people and institutions that have been honored have the deepest and deepest recognition, admiration and respect of the Brazilian government.
You are fighting for the elderly, indigenous people, quilombolas, children, for ending racism and for combating violence against women.
By striving to reduce inequalities and guarantee rights, you push the country forward.
It is the duty of the democratic state and government to defend and protect those who are most fragile. #Human Rights Award
The entire population must be provided with quality services, but we must give due attention to those who are excluded.
We stubbornly fight violence against women, a crime that shames society and compromises family values. #Human rights
We are aware that the root of inequality is fought from childhood. Therefore, the 6 thousand creeches we build are important.
Today, the #David National Commission has made public its report after 2 years and 7 months of work.
This is a fundamental step of a right of Brazilians: to know their history so that we can build a better society.
In a country like ours, people like you are an example and this creates ethical and moral values. You fill us with pride. #Human rights
I would like to close with a simple thank you for what you do every day. #Human Rights Award
Photos of the ceremony of delivery of the #Human Rights Award http://t.co/CExy8YB17d
